item.title: Making a Simple GUI [Tutorial] Fully Explained. [UPDATED] 3/7/08
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:81, topic:113534”][quote author=Coder xynt link=topic=162314.msg2465755#msg2465755 date=1222713394]
Just a little comment on the tut:
Why the hell you would use ‘Runtime.getRuntime().exec(“rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.URL.com”);’ to browse a page when you can use the ‘browse’ method located in the java.awt.Desktop class.
[/quote]
… This was from 2 summers ago. I know that now. and i think that the Runtime gets your default browser, and desktop starts up IE.[/quote]If I am not mistaken, it also fucks up your application for anything other than Windows (I haven’t done any research, but it looks that way to me). Which is just fucking dumb.

Also, if anything, I think that runtime would launch IE seeing as you are using a plugin built into Windows?

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Simple GUI [Tutorial] Fully Explained. [UPDATED] 3/7/08

item.title: Making a Simple GUI [Tutorial] Fully Explained. [UPDATED] 3/7/08
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:73, topic:113534”][quote author=pizza pie link=topic=162314.msg1665896#msg1665896 date=1186812881]
“this” is more professional, easier to understand, and looks better. And Frell’s idea too
[/quote]
Why did i get the impression that you thought that was a good thing.

[code] if(cmd.equals(“BUTTON NAME”)) {
try {
this.setSize(330,200);
this.setResizable(false);
this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
this.setTitle(“NEWFRAMETITLE”);

		JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();
		JButton button1 = new JButton("Button");
		frame.add(panel1);
		panel1.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER));
		panel1.add(button1);
		this.setVisible(false);

frame.setvisible(true);

}
   		
   		} catch (Exception e) {}
    } [/code]

l2indent[/quote]
l2 read dates.

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Simple GUI [Tutorial] Fully Explained. [UPDATED] 3/7/08

item.title: Making a Simple GUI [Tutorial] Fully Explained. [UPDATED] 3/7/08
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

pizza pie:

“this” is more professional, easier to understand, and looks better. And Frell’s idea too

Why did i get the impression that you thought that was a good thing.

[code] if(cmd.equals(“BUTTON NAME”)) {
try {
this.setSize(330,200);
this.setResizable(false);
this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
this.setTitle(“NEWFRAMETITLE”);

		JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();
		JButton button1 = new JButton("Button");
		frame.add(panel1);
		panel1.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER));
		panel1.add(button1);
		this.setVisible(false);

frame.setvisible(true);

}
   		
   		} catch (Exception e) {}
    } [/code]

l2indent

item.title: Making a Simple GUI [Tutorial] Fully Explained. [UPDATED] 3/7/08
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Iamadam, post:59, topic:113534”][quote author=Lithium-Oxide link=topic=162314.msg1654964#msg1654964 date=1186366333]
if you declare your class you dont have to use ‘this’ everywhere

private static ClassName a;

tuh duh you can replace all ‘this’ for ‘a’
[/quote]
Or you can do it the correct way, and use ‘this.’
You can even scrap the ‘this’ all together, if there is no ambiguity.[/quote]
Using “this” also makes it more understandable for noobs.

Read full topic
